intro: Malvastrum famatinensis, commonly known as the Famatinian mallow, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, showy flowers that range in color from pink to red. It typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid conditions. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
